meanings.sent1: The teacher was promulgating the test results to the students.
meanings.sent2: The company is promulgating its new product through social media.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was promulgating its presence by chattering loudly in the tree.
meanings.sent4: The rising sun promulgated its light across the horizon.
meanings.sent5: The loudspeaker promulgated the emergency announcement throughout the building.

meanings.sent1: The mayor will be promulgating the new city ordinance tomorrow.
meanings.sent2: The government is promulgating the new tax laws next week.
meanings.sent3: The cat promulgated its ownership of the house by leaving fur on every surface.
meanings.sent4: The thunderstorm promulgated its power with booming thunder and bright lightning.
meanings.sent5: The marching band promulgated their presence with a lively performance.
